text: HARVEY HUTCHINSON, 44, confident, full of ambition, and i his underwear, grooms himself for work while listening to motivational PODCAST through headphones.

You want to reach the top of the ladder, my friend? Then grab your balls and take no prisoners. It’s kill or be killed... Harvey poses in the mirror like a gunslinger. He quick dr one hand like a pistol, grabs his balls with the other, t pulls the imaginary trigger.
Bam!

Harvey's dressed for success and lookin’ sharp. He approa his SON’S BEDROOM, sniffs the air and stops. He holds his nose to block the smell and enters without a knock. INT. HUTCH’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS A disaster area. Dirty clothes and fast food wrappers lit the floor. FHM girls and NASCAR posters cover the walls. Harvey spots the source of the stink in the corner. A MOL BUG INFESTED, BURRITO SUPREME.

Hutch! I told you to clean this room and not to leave food- He YANKS back the blanket. But Hutch’s bed is empty. Harvey looks over to see the family dog, RACHAEL RAY, a portly pug, scarfing down the moldy burrito remains.
Rachael Ray, NO! That’s disgusting.
Harvey comes down the stairs. His blossoming daughter, NI HUTCHINSON, 14, sits on the couch, working on her laptop.
Morning, Nic.
Hey. He notices her t-shirt: A billiard rack with “NICE” in th middle.
You leave the house in that shirt, you’re grounded for life.
Why? It just means I’m good at shooting pool. He gives her a knowing look.
Are you going to help me with my video project for school like you keep promising?
You need to get the VHS tapes transferred to your computer like I told you. She points to her laptop.
Done. A week ago. Like I told you yesterday.
Good. We’1l work on it Saturday.
Yeah, right. And I’m banging the Jonas Brothers.
Watch your mouth. From the kitchen comes MARILYN HUTCHINSON, 42, attentive and real estate agent. She hands Harvey a cup of coffee.
Breakfast?
Running late. Where’s Hutch?
Sleeping?
He’s not in his room. And I’ve told him a dozen times not to leave food in there, it smells like Tijuana. Nicole comments on the transferred video on her computer.
Nice hair in the 80’s, Mom. You look John Mayer.
Everyone’s hair was bad in the 80's, Nic. (to Harvey) Dinner?
Working late. Don’t wait.
Remember our talk about balance?
That’s why I have you. He gives her a quick kiss and is out the door.

Harvey spots a MILLER BEER CAN on the lawn...and then another, and another. The trail of cans lead to the POOL where Harvey sees... HUTCH HUTCHINSON, 21, a soon-to-be college junior disguis as a shaggy mess of a slacker, is PASSED OUT ON A RAFT in clothes from the night before. Harvey grabs the pool skimmer and FLIPS THE RAFT, DUMPING HUTCH INTO THE WATER.
Good morning, sunshine.
That was not cool, Dad.
Neither are the maggots living in your room. He tosses an empty Miller can at Hutch.
Or you bringing the competition into my home.
They were out of Hibrau.
You shouldn't be drinking anyway.
Then start acting like it. Harvey glances over at his prized ROSE BUSHES.
My babies look dry. Tell me you're sticking to the watering schedule?
C'mon. Can you stop harassing me about everything?
I'm the boss. Someday you'll have a kid then you’1l be the boss. Until then I need you to pick up lawn bags and a new rake at the hardware store.
I don’t have any cash.
Shocker. Harvey takes out his wallet and hands Hutch his Am-Ex car
Let’s get on it. And don’t use the card for anything else, got me? Harvey gives him a condescending grin, then heads off.

The hustle and bustle of a mid-size brewery in action. FACTORY WORKERS and EXECS showing up to work. - BREWMASTE tasting their mixture. - Bottles filled and capped on the assembly line. - A FORKLIFT DRIVER hauls cases of Hibrau.

Harvey parks his Lincoln Navigator in the huge lot. As he walks through the rows, he stops to admire the high European sedans in the “RESERVED EXECUTIVE PARKING” secti Near the main building, Harvey stops at a statue of OLD- JONES, a guy from the 1880's. He's sporting a top hat and tails and holding up a bottle of Hibrau. A plaque reads: “HIBRAU LAGER - MILWAUKEE’S LOYAL FRIEND SINCE 1883”.
(grabbing his balls) You and me, Jonesy. We take no prisoners.
Harvey zigzags through a maze of cubicles. Promotional displays and test market products are scattered everywher Outside his modest office, he’s greeted by his assistant, JANIS, 50.
Morning, Mr. Hutchinson.
Good morning, Janis. Third quarter sales report? She hands it to him. He flips to the last page.
Ouch. Shit is going to hit the fan. (beat) (MORE )
But like The Donald says, “Sometimes by losing a battle you find a new way to win the war.”
Staff meeting’s in ten minutes.
Bring it on. He tucks the sales report under his arm and heads off.

CEO, ARTHUR BRACKEN, 64, a tough as nails silver fox, pac around the conference table that includes Harvey and the of the marketing department. They are listening to Senior V.P. of Sales, ELMER WINTHORPE, 60. Winthorpe points to a MOCK-UP AD of Old-Jones, wearing hi top-hat, in front of a fire with a cat curled up on his l
And then Old-Jones says, “What do you think, Pussy? Shall we crack open another Hibrau? And then the cat says, “One loyal friend deserves another.” Bracken rubs his temples. Frustrated.
The cat talks?
He says, “One loyal friend deserves another.”
Has Old-Jones gone senile? Is that why he talks to a cat?
I’m sorry, Arthur?
Old-Jones, the iconic symbol of the Hibrau Brewing company, is having a conversation with a cat, so I’m assuming he’s developed Alzheimer's.
Um, no, the uh...
Shut up, Winthorpe! And we're wondering why sales are off twenty percent? Does anyone here have any good ideas, for God’s sake? (beat)
Harvey confidently stands up.
The cat meows. Bracken stares at Harvey for a long beat.
Pussy knows what it wants, Arthur.
I like it! Good work Hutchinson. Make it happen.
As the meeting breaks up, Harvey files out. His go-with-t flow buddy, PHIL DAVIS, 40's, comes over.
Gutsy move, Harv.
You want to get to the top? Sometimes you grab your nut sack.
Interesting concept. KEITH PITTMAN, 38, your typical back stabbing co-worker, slaps Harvey on the shoulder.
Smooth move, Hutchinson. Better grease up the next kayak to Kenosha.
Pittman, if you’re going to make an insult, it helps if people have a clue as to what you’re talking about.
Well just remember what happened to the last guy that a took steamer on one of Winthorpe’s ideas.
You think I’m worried about- Winthorpe beelines over. He’s not happy.

Yes, sir. Pittman smirks as Harvey fights to keep his composure. INT. HUTCHINSON HOME - HUTCH’S ROOM - DAY Rachael Ray is perched on Hutch’s lap as he and his buddi down cans of BUDWEISER and play NASCAR ‘09 on PlayStation There’s Hutch’s better half and BFF, TEDDY O’Neil, 21. Th book smart, 5 foot 3, RILEY FORD, 21. And GREG WARBURTON, he can rebuild an engine and kick your ass at the same ti

See that, Ted-O? That was Jeff Gordon dusting your redneck Dale Earnhardt ass. Riley, hold on to your scrote-bag ‘cause here I come. Hutch's fingers dance expertly over his controller as his Jeff Gordon car motors past Riley's Jimmi Johnson car.
Bitch!
Sick move, Hutch. Guess there is an upside to you playing this thing twelve hours a day.
Jealousy is a very ugly quality, Warburton. But I will admit, if I could major in NASCAR ‘09, I'd contemplate going back to school.
You tell Harv yet that you’re taking the year off?
Waiting for the right moment.
He’s going to flip his shit.
Might. But I’ve got my life to think about, right? (quick taps controller) Laters, Warburton. Hutch leaves Warburton’s Kyle Bush in his wake and TAKES CHECKERED FLAG. Rachael Ray BARKS her congrats.
Chicken dinner, ladies! Riley tosses a victory Budweiser to Hutch. He toasts virt Jeff Gordon on the TV.
Hells bells, Wonder Boy. He swigs the beer then gives Rachael Ray her share.
That was the last one. Beer run? INT. WINTHORPE’S OFFICE - DAY Harvey sits across from Winthorpe in his plush corner off
Hutchinson, who plucked you from the warehouse at twenty-five?
You did, Elmer.
And who gave you your first promotion, your last promotion and every damn promotion in between?
You, Elmer.

head_text.subj: AND YOU STAB ME IN THE BACK

text: I was just-  10.
Do you know what Bracken said to me after the meeting? That my ideas were antiquated. Winthorpe points to a decades old logo of Old-Jones.
I created Old-Jones in ‘72... Winthorpe SHOVES a recent bottle of Hibrau in Harvey’s fa Same exact logo.
And the top-hatted son of a bitch is still selling beer today! That's not a coincidence, that’s staying power, Hutchinson. Something you clearly don’t have anymore!
Elmer-
WE’RE DONE. GET OUT OF MY FACE! Fuming pissed, Winthorpe spins his chair, turning his bac Harvey gets up and shuffles out.
Agggh! Harvey turns back.
Sir? No answer. Harvey closes the door behind him. INT. WARBURTON’S JEEP WRANGLER - DAY Hutch and crew cruise in Warburton’s ridiculously jacked Bronco.
You really should consider joining me, Ted-O. A year off from school could be the experience of a lifetime. No classes, sleeping ‘till noon, then getting lit the rest of the day.  INT. 11.
Uh, we've been doing that all summer.
Yeah, but how cool would it be to do it in colder weather? Just tell your pops you need to “find yourself” or something.
He’s right, Teddy. You’re wasting your time with that shit.
What, getting an education so he doesn’t end up at Auto Zone?
Funny one, little man. Least I make bank. Lot of good that diploma’s done you.
I’m still weighing my employment opportunities.
Bet they weigh less then you.
Warburton, 7-11 on your left.
Hutch and Teddy hit the beer fridge. Hutch scans right pa the Hibrau and grabs a 12 pack of COORS LIGHT.
I'm feeling like the cold refreshment of the Rockies. Cool?
Lock and load the Silver Bullets, baby. Grab two. He dumps two 12’s in Teddy’s arms.
I’m cashed out and you're up. Teddy searches his pockets. He pulls out a crumpled coupo  12.
All I got is a 1/2 off ona Domino’s two topping. Hutch contemplates. Then pulls out Harvey’s gold Am-EX.
The things I sacrifice for us. Meet you outside.
A kind-of-cute CASHIER, 21, rings up the beer.
Hey, I remember you from High School. Hutch Hutchinson, right?
In the flesh. Hutch hands over Harvey's credit card.
Wow, Gold Card. You must be doing well?
Some of us are just destined for greatness. She looks at the name on card.
Yeah, right. Still using Daddy’s card are we?
Uh, Hutch is short for Harvey...in Dubai. I’m half Dubai...a-nin.
Nice try. Hutch GRABS an assortment of crappy counter items includi lighters, key chains, calling cards and chick magazines.
Would I buy all these personal gifts for you, including fifty of those Lucky 7 lotto scratchers, if this wasn’t my card?  13.
Seriously? You’re going to buy me all this stuff?
If you give me your phone number, foxy lady, this is all yours.
You're cute. Make it a hundred lotto scratchers and you got a deal.
Done.
Out by the Old-Jones statue, Harvey vents to Phil.
He’s not going to fire you, Harv. You know how Winthorpe gets.
He was practically foaming at the mouth. Ungrateful S.0O.B. is lucky I saved his ass in that meeting. Harvey looks up at Old-Jones. Has a moment.

You know what? I’m done being bullied. I’m marching into Winthorpe’s office, tell him he can go to hell and- Harvey and Phil JUMP BACK as an AMBULANCE screeches to a right in front of them. PARAMEDICS rush out and thunder i the building.
The elevator doors open. Harvey and Phil step out to see Paramedics at work as employees crowd around WINTHORPE’S OFFICE. Harvey moves in closer.
Oh my God! The Paramedics lift a rigor stiff WINTHORPE off his chair place him on a the gurney. Pittman steps up next to Harve  14.
Looks like Elmer bought the farm...but you ran away with all the pigs.
What? SARGENT HEINRICK, a Nazi-like Hibrau security guard approaches Harvey.

Mr. Hutchinson, it appears that you were the last one to see Mr. Winthorpe alive. His last words to you were probably his last words on earth. As they wheel Winthorpe past Harvey, he observes the FROZ ANGRY GRIMACE on Winthorpe’s face.
He said, uh, “Good job”. Sargent Heinrick makes some notes and follows the paramed Mr. Bracken comes over to Harvey.
Elmer Winthorpe, he was a good man, Arthur. This is a real tragedy.
(leans in, whispers) It’s a good thing he bit the dust, otherwise he’d be out of a job. Harvey shivers at Bracken’s coldness.
I’m not saying anything, Hutchinson, but Elmer’s shoes need to be filled and I’ve got an idea of who’s going to be doing the filling. Harvey smiles, quickly getting over the loss.
Harvey rants like a hyper puppy as the family eats dinner Hutch sneaks Rachael Ray spaghetti under the table.  15.
Of course I’m upset that Winthorpe’s dead. But it was his time. And now it’s mine.
You're a monster, Harv.
Agreed.
You guys won’t be saying that after I become a Vice President. It’s going to change everything.
That’s what that Cheney dude said. Hutch drops Rachael Ray a handful of pasta. She INHALES i
Hutch, are you feeding the dog from the table?
What? No.
We'll be able to get into the Fair Oaks Country Club. Go on great vacations with the other execs.
I’d rather become a hooker. Harvey's on a roll. Doesn't even hear her.
Nicole, enough.
And guess who'll be watching Bucks games from the company floor seats?
Jack Nicholson?
Bracken already bumped me to the top of the list for tickets. Hutch slyly palms a huge meatball, tosses it to Rachael R  16.
You haven’t even been offered the job, Harvey.
Arthur practically guaranteed it. We just need a little time. Out of respect for Winthorpe.
Aren't you the saint. Rachael Ray RIPS a gas bomb. Harvey glares at Hutch.
I’m not feeding her!
I’ve waited a long time for this promotion and fate has finally arrived. Harvey's feeling good. Hutch takes the opportunity.
Speaking of fate, I, uh, have a small announcement.
We already know, you’re gay.
Funny one. (beat) So, I’ve decided to take things in a new direction with school. Harvey sports a big grin.
You've decided on a major! That's great, Hutch. Business or marketing?
Well, neither. (beat) I’m, uh, taking a year off from school.
Ouch. Didn't see that one coming.  17.
Excuse me?
Before you go psycho, just listen. This plan helps out all of us. Marilyn puts her hand on Harvey’s to calm him down.
Go ahead.

Okay. Since I have yet to clearly define my career path, it makes smart business sense, especially in these tough economic times, to evaluate the various opportunities out there. So why not take a year off, really research this thing, and “find myself”? Then bang! I’m back in school, heading toward a career and a life filled with huge financial rewards and tons of emotional stability. To top things off, you guys won’t have to worry about cash if things get really bad. ‘Ol Hutch here will unselfishly be able to provide for the whole family and we’ll live happily ever after. (like Barack Obama) Yes, we can. Silence. They all stare at him. He smiles back.
Call me when the shit storm blows over. Nicole gets up and leaves.
That's it? That’s your plan?
Well I might travel a little in between the research. You know what they say, “All work and no play”-
ARE YOU INSANE? Do you know how hard I work so you can go to college? A luxury I never had!  18.
Hutch, this might not be the right decision.
I’m just not sure if school’s my thing right now.
I‘1l tell you one thing, mister, it’s going to look really bad that a Vice President’s son is a college drop out! Hutch is put off by Harvey’s comment.
Harvey, calm down. That’s not the issue here.
I’ve made up my mind. I’m not going back.
Okay smart guy, what are you going to do for money? Because you're not free loading around this house like you've done all summer.
I already told you, I’'11l be doing research.

If you’re not going to school, then you're getting a job! Then you'll see how lucky you are to be in college. Tomorrow morning you are out pounding the pavement. No more free rides here, pal. Harvey storms away from the table, but STOPS as Rachael R blocks his path, staring up at him.
Go on! Move it, girl. Rachael Ray convulses...then PUKES SPAGHETTI on Harvey’s shoe.
INT. HUTCHINSON HOME - HUTCH’S ROOM - MORNING Harvey enters and BANGS on his briefcase like a drum.

head_text.subj: OKAY, MR. FIND YOURSELF GUY, TIME

text: But Hutch isn’t there. On top of it, the bed is made. Har shrugs. Maybe he’s getting through to him. INT. HARVEY’S CAR - MORNING Harvey drives to work, listening to more motivational cra
Now say it! Nothing will stand in my way of success. I will get what I want.
Nothing will stand in my way of success! I will get what I want. SUDDENLY, in the rearview mirror, A HALF NAKED GIRL pops from the back seat. It’s the CASHIER from 7-11.
Where am I?
Harvey SWERVES out of traffic and pulls the car to the cu
The last thing I remember is we were smoking this killer weed.
Harvey sees HUTCH PASSED OUT in the back in a sea of junk food wrappers and slurpee cups. Harvey smacks him awake. Hutch looks up.
Shit.  20.
Cashier hurries out of the car, fumbling with her clothes Hutch leans out the window.
I‘1l hit you later, cool?
Screw you, loser. I knew you were full of crap! Harvey looks at Hutch and shakes his head.
Look Dad, I-
Not a word. Not one word!
Harvey drags Hutch over to OSCAR, 50’s, brewery foreman.
Hey Oscar, How’s it goin’?
Harvey!
You remember my son, Hutch?
Sure. Sure. You were bussing tables at your dad’s BBQ last summer.
That’s me. Jack of all trades...and slave labor.
Tell me Harv, how are things in white-collar world?
I’m still the same guy, just wearing a different uniform. Hutch rolls his eyes.  21.
Speaking of uniforms, baseball starts in a week. This is our year.

Gonna crush those wimps from Pabst! So Oscar, Hutch here is looking for a job and I thought this would be a great place for him to start. He’ll work hard and you can pay him minimum wage. What do you say?
Of course. If he’s anything like his old man he’1l be running the place in no time.
I’m nothing like him.
I always tell the boys in the warehouse, if you think this is the end of the road, just look at Harvey Hutchinson. He’s proof that there’s no limit to your dreams.
You speak the truth, my friend. (walking off) Put the kid to work.
Harvey passes Winthorpe’s old corner office. He peeks INS to see painters and carpet guys changing it up.
(like a mad scientist) Soon you will be mine, all mine.
Hutch is drenched with sweat and miserable as he lifts ca of beer off the assembly line and onto a pallet. Musclehe co-worker, Jake, 30's, works effortlessly alongside Hutch
Told ya this is an awesome workout, Hutchinson. FEEL THE BURN! Hutch can hardly breath. He stops and leans over.
Uh, huh. I need a sec.
Well, hurry up. I gotta get toa veterinarian.
A veterinarian? Jake flexes his arms.
Yeah, my pythons are sick! Jake sticks his bicep in Hutch’s face.
Feel these bastards!
(creeped out) Seriously, I’m good.
See how thick the vein is? That’s from hauling kegs, amigo. Go on, stroke that puppy. Jake doesn’t move his arm. Hutch awkwardly touches it.
I’m not real comfortable with this.
Yo Jake, that your new girlfriend? They turn around to see, ANGELA, 20's, smokin’ hot blue 22. collar chick, sitting in the driver's seat of a forklift. Jake quickly pushes Hutch away. Turns psycho.

head_text.subj: GET THE HELL AWAY FROM ME BEFORE I

text: (terrified) I wasn’t...he told me to...
TOUCH ME AGAIN AND I’LL RIP OFF
Hutch is about to piss his pants as Jake stares him down a raging bull.
Give the kid a break, Jake. I don’t thinks he’s your type.
Come on, we're getting backed up. Angela forks the pallet and steers toward the docks. Jake eases up, puts his hand on Hutch’s shoulder.
Sorry about that, Hutchinson. Didn't want her to think I was into weird shit. Thanks for covering.
(weakly) No problem. You’re hurting my shoulder. Jake lets go. Hutch strains to get a final peek at Angela
I gotta stop mixing the roids with the Red Bull. Gets me a tad zippy.
Never would have known.

head_text.subj: OKAY, YOU READY FOR A TRICEP PARTY

text: He throws Hutch a stack of cases. Hutch drops to his knee
Practice has finished. Harvey and Phil take off their cle
(like an announcer) Batting third and playing short stop, Vice President of Sales, Haaaarveeey Huuuthcinson.  24. He makes crowd cheering noises.
Promotion’s looking good, huh?
I’d say any day now. Harvey pulls a MERCEDES BENZ BROCHURE out of his gym bag.
Check this out. The Mercedes S-600. This baby screams success.
Nice.
Even nicer with 20” rims and a gun metal metallic paint job. That’s how a V.P. rolls, my friend.
Hutch is sprawled out on a lounge chair, exhausted from w Harvey comes through the gate carrying a garden hose.
Hey pal, how’s it goin’ in the real world? Are you finding yourself?
(groans ) I can’t feel my arms.
Not too late to register for classes.
Forget it. You’ll never break me.
I like your energy. Use it to clean out the garage this weekend. He tosses the hose on top of Hutch.
Roses look hungry. Make them happy. Hutch grumbles as Harvey walks off with a whistle.  25.
Nicole’s working on her video project. Her laptop is hook up to the TV which shows A YOUNGER HARVEY DANCING UP A ST AT A PARTY, circa 1983. Harvey enters with his head in the Mercedes brochure.
Dad, are you gonna help me with this or what?
What’s that? He’s completely focused on the brochure.
Taking me to get a boob job.
A little later, honey.
You’re not even listening! I need help with my project. Harvey looks up from the brochure. See’s himself on the T
Hey, I remember that! He does a Michael Jackson move from Thriller. Not bad.
Your old man could tear up the dance floor!
Oh-my-God. Don’t ever do that in front of me again. He goes back to the brochure and heads out.
Marilyn does the dishes while Harvey places some of his freshly clipped roses in a vase.
Hutch has been at the garage for hours.  26.
Good. The new Benz’1l need a clean home.
You're being a little hard on him.
All for his own good, Mare. Eventually he’1l realize that his butt should be back in school.
The place is a mess. Hutch and Teddy sport improvised hoc gear with bike helmets, gardening knee pads and golf club Hutch maneuvers an empty beer can toward Teddy.
Five seconds left in the period. Hutchinson shoots...He scores! The can RICOCHETS past Teddy and SMASHES through a window
Oh, shit.
Shit, my ass. The USA just won the gold medal! Hutch moves a stack of boxes to hide the broken window th goes to the fridge and grabs a couple cans of Harvey's Hibrau. They crack ‘em open and guzzle.
You'd think as your buzz heightens, this Hibrau piss water wouldn't continue to taste like my ass.
Speaking of ass, there’s going to be a ton of it next week at Fogelman’s barbecue.
Great. I have to work. I’m telling you, Ted-O, this job is ruining my life.
Then quit.  27.
Can’t. Harv will make me go back to school. (veading Hibrau can) “Milwaukee’s loyal friend”, my ass!
Why don’t you just get fired? Hutch thinks for a moment. Grins.
Show me the money.
A buzzed Hutch and Teddy are deep into a twelve pack as H pounds away on his laptop.

(Reading as he types) “,...and furthermore, Hibrau tastes like watered down near beer and the marketing has no appeal to anyone under fifty. No hot chicks in the ads, sponsorship at sporting events or cool dudes in movies chugging it. Just some lame old top-hat dude on the brink of death. The bottom line is that Hibrau sucks and everything associated with it makes me think of my great grandfather. And he’s dead.”
That’s awesome! It’ll get you canned for sure. Maybe even sued.
And here’s the thing, I’m just telling the truth. Jerry Maguire's got nothing on me. I’m sending it. Company wide. On his computer, Hutch selects the e-mail folder, “all@hibrau.com”, and hits send.
Janis intercepts Harvey as he heads to his office.  28.
Mr. Hutchinson, Mr. Bracken just called an emergency meeting in the brewery. The entire company.
Meeting? About what?
Might have something to do with your great grandfather. The one who's dead.
What are you talking about?
The place is filling up with execs, office staff and brew workers. Harvey enters.
Wow. Ballsy move, Harv.
Huh? Another co-worker gives him the thumbs-up.
What? From the FRONT of the brewery Bracken WAVES Hutch’s email
Hutchinson, come up here now! Harvey points to himself, “Me?”
Up at that front Harvey scans Hutch’s email. Shocked.
I had high hopes for you, Hutchinson. I knew you had that something, but this-
Arthur, I swear, I did not write this email.
No?
I've worked for this company for 25 years. I respect what we represent. I would never say these things.
I’m puzzled, Hutchinson. The email came from H. Hutchinson?
(leans in, whispers) That’s my son, Hutch. He’s been working in the warehouse. I apologize-
Well then, it seems that things have taken an interesting turn.
Bracken reads Hutch’s email out loud to the entire compan Harvey stands off to the side, cringing with every word.

“,..and the marketing has no appeal to anyone under fifty. No hot chicks in the ads, sponsorship at sporting events or cool dudes in movies chugging it. Just some lame old top-hat dude on the brink of death.”
(sotto) I am so screwed.
“The bottom line is that Hibrau sucks and everything associated with it makes me think of my great grandfather. And he’s dead.” (he scans the crowd) Where is Hutch Hutchinson?

head_text.subj: IN THE BACK OF THE ROOM

text: Hutch hides his grin, ready to face the firing squad and the hell out of there.  30.
Right here, sir. I’m Hutch Hutchinson.
Come up here, son.
(sotto) It’s party time. The crowd parts as Hutch struts up to Bracken. He passes Harvey who shoots him daggers.
(mouthing) You are dead, mister. Hutch makes his way next to Bracken.
You wrote this?
Yes, sir.
And you think you know how to run this company better than me?
No, sir. It’s just that me and my boys drink a lot of beer and these are just some ideas of how to-
It’s brilliant! The everyman’s perspective. Real beer drinkers! Hutch is baffled, as is Harvey.

It’s about time someone has the guts to address why this company is in the toilet! Desperate times call for desperate measures. It’s time to take a fresh approach and turn things around. He puts his hand on Hutch’s shoulder. Looks out to the cr

head_text.subj: THE NEW VICE PRESIDENT OF SALES,

text: Hutch looks at him, “What the fuck?” The crowd CHEERS. Except for Harvey who looks like he jus got run over by a truck.
Harvey exits the building gasping for air.
This is not happening. He stomps into the parking lot, paces.
Definitely not happening. I’m dreaming or hallucinating or ina coma. A worker passes him.

Did ya here about the kid they made a Vice President? Pretty cool, huh? Harvey just grumbles and walks on. He KICKS and PUNCHES a nothing but air, let’s out a few screams. He stop at the “RESERVED - EXECUTIVE PARKING” sign and PO ON IT, SLAPS IT, TRIES TO BEND IT. He’s in a total meltdo He grabs the light post the sign is attached to and VIOLE SHAKES IT.

CREAK. Harvey looks up to see that the LIGHT FIXTURE snap loose from the light housing. It dangles by a wire and then...FREE-FALLS...CRASHING THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD OF TH BENTLEY COUP THAT SITS BELOW IT.
Crap! Something catches Harvey’s eye at the front of the Bentle
Oh, no. God, no. He creeps to the front of the car. Scans the placard. CLOSE ON - “RESERVED FOR ARTHUR BRACKEN CEO”  32.
(takes a breath) Okay Harvey, calm down. Not a big deal- CLUNK...The LIGHT HOUSING falls and PIERCES through the Bentley’s hood.
Holy shit! Harvey sprints off toward the main building.

woooo HOOOO! She cracks up and dances back to the girls.

Why not?
I don’t know. It seems kind of ridiculous. He grabs the badger head from Phil and puts it on.
Check this out. Harvey heads over to the refrigerator, but has a hard tim navigating all the clutter. He mutters to himself, but ca barely be understood through the giant foam head.
(muffled) I’ve told that kid a thousand times to clean this garage.
What’s that, Harv?
Nothing.  65. He gets to the fridge and pulls out a six-pack of Hibrau. Holds it up.
“Hibrau Lager, for the badger in all of us.” Phil stares at him for a long moment.
I don’t get it.
Forget the copy. The badger is funny, right?
You’re not selling me here.
You need to think outside the box. Come on, put yours on and we’ll get a second opinion from Marilyn.
CLOSE ON - Hutch sits at the feast-filled dining room tab telling a story.

And then my buddy Warburton says, “You really want it, officer? Then come pull it out of my ass.” REVEAL - BRACKEN sits at the other end of the table. He almost chokes on his drink, then bursts out laughing.
Son, that could be one of the greatest stories I’ve ever heard!
I got a ton of ‘em, sir. Bracken leans back with a full belly.
That meatloaf was superb. And those potatoes, out of this world.
That Marilyn, she can cook.  66.
I’ve got to tell you, Hutch, you’ve brought a new spark to this company.
I do what I do, sir. Another brandy, Mr. Bracken?
Don’t mind if I do. And it’s high time you call me Arthur. Hutch fills Bracken’s glass then raises his.
Cheers to you, Arthur.
Harvey and Phil, both dressed in the badger costumes, ent through the screen door.
I feel like an idiot in this thing.
Will you stop? Harvey pushes through the swinging door AND SEES BRACKEN SITTING AT THE DINING ROOM TABLE. He backs into the kitchen, KNOCKING INTO PHIL. They both CRASH TO THE FLOOR.
Hey! What the hell- Harvey puts his hand over the mouth of Phil’s badger head
Shhhh! Oh my God. Bracken.
What about him?
He’s sitting at my dining room table.
You're kidding me?  67.

Hutch, that little brown nose. (beat) Come on. We can’t let Bracken see us like this. They turn to sneak out the screen door, but Hutch and Bra are now STANDING OUT BY THE POOL. Bracken offers Hutch a cigar and lights it.
Crap! We’re going to have go through the front and around. They push through the kitchen and into...
Where RACHAEL RAY POPS UP from the couch. She GROWLS at t
Quiet, Rachael Ray! It’s me, your master. She BARKS. Her eyes go bug-eyed, freaking out.
Phil, grab me some scraps from the table. Harvey reaches his hand back, keeping his eyes on Rachael as Phil hands him the ENTIRE MEATLOAF.
(realizing) I said scraps, not the whole- Too late. Rachael Ray rushes Harvey and SNATCHES the meatloaf.
What part of “scraps” didn't you understand?
That dog is psycho. Rachael Ray guards the meatloaf. She becomes more aggress BARKING at Harvey and Phil.
Give me that bottle of Brandy.  68.
I'm thinking this is not the right time for drinks.
Just hand me the bottle, please. Phil hands it to him. Harvey pours a few drops in his pal and holds it out to Rachael Ray.
Come here, girl. Rachael Ray calms down. She comes over to Harvey and laps the Brandy from his palm.
That’s it, Rachael Ray. Good dog- Rachael Ray LUNGES at Harvey’s other hand and grabs the brandy bottle. She darts up the stairs with it in her mou
That takes care of that.

Impressive. Harvey and Phil continue to the front door. As Harvey reaches for the handle, the door opens and NICO ENTERS. She SCREAMS, having no idea it’s Harvey and Phil. They struggle to take off their badger heads.

head_text.subj: YOU SICK PERVERTS, GET OUT OF MY

text: Nicole reaches into her pack back...
(mumbling through costume) Calm down! It’s me- ...and WHIPS OUT A CAN OF PEPPER SPRAY, SPRAYING THEM THR THE OPENINGS IN THE BADGER HEADS.
OOWWWW! Stop-  69. Nicole dodges past them. She PUSHES them out the door and SLAMS it SHUT.
Harvey and Phil TUMBLE onto the front lawn, ROLLING AROUN BLINDED. They finally get the badger heads off.
It burns! Harvey grabs the garden hose. He DOUSES Phil’s face, then own. They lay back, exhausted.
I told you this was a bad idea! From the other side of the fence they hear...
I’m hoping the boys in marketing are going to knock our socks off next week with the new ideas.
I’ve been on top of them, Arthur.
Hide! Harvey and Phil SCRAMBLE INTO THE BUSHES as Bracken and H come through the side gate.
Speaking of ideas, Arthur, are you familiar with NASCAR?
The car racing?
Fastest growing sport in the world, and the perfect opportunity to nail the younger demographic. I’m thinking it’s where we should be.
Interesting. I like it.
Harvey and Phil listen.  70.
Are you kidding me?
As fate would have it, they’re racing here this weekend at the Speedway. The Milwaukee 500. I'd like to do a little research.
You have my blessing. Whatever you need.

Thank you, Arthur. RACHAEL RAY, with blood shot eyes, STUMBLES out of the ho She has the empty brandy bottle in her mouth. Rachael Ray sniffs the air, locking onto a scent. She dro the brandy bottle and RUNS TOWARD THE BUSHES. HARVEY watches as Rachael Ray beelines for the bushes. Sh stumbles, face-plants, then gets up and darts toward them
Crap. Rachael Ray reaches the bushes. She bares her teeth and begins BARKING WITH A SLUR.
Rachael Ray, shoo. Get away. HUTCH notices Rachael Ray barking drunkenly at the bushes
What is it, Rachael Ray? Rachael Ray is going NUTS, FOAMING AT THE MOUTH.

Might be a rabbit in there. Rachael Ray DIVES INTO THE BUSHES and... ATTACKS Harvey and Phil. BITING, CLAWING, SCRATCHING. The put the badger heads back on for protection. Rachael Ray mounts Harvey’s face. She looks Harvey in his badger eyes...AND PUKES INTO THEM.
Rachael Ray leaps onto Phil.
They SPRING FROM THE BUSHES in a panic, REVEALING THEMSEL
What in God’s name!? Hutch contains his laughter, knowing it’s Harvey and Phil
There’s been reported robberies in the neighborhood, sir. Media's coined them the “Rat Bandits”.
Not on my watch! Bracken grabs the rake off the lawn and BEATS ON THE BADG as Rachael Ray continues her attack.

(with each beat of the rake) NOBODY-STEALS-FROM-MY-EMPLOYEES. Harvey and Phil FLAIL under Bracken’s beating. As they tr run away... Bracken throws the rake at them and it gets caught up in Phil's feet, tripping him. Harvey helps him up and they t off down the street.
Don’t think you'll be having a problem with them anymore.
Thank you, sir. You’re a hero to the neighborhood. Rachael Ray looks up at them...HICCUPS.
That’s a good girl!
Hutch is kicked back watching TV. Harvey enters, battered bruised from the badger ordeal.  72.
Hey Harv, you don’t look so good. What happened to you?
Real funny, isn’t it?
Well you gotta admit it’s kind of funny. But no worries, I didn’t blow your cover and I convinced Mom not to call the cops.
Yeah? Well now my badger presentation’s blown.
Look at it as me saving you from embarrassment.
You think you know it all, don’t you? Harvey turns off the TV.
I was sort of watching that.
Well you’re not watching it anymore. I want the garage cleaned out, and take out the garbage then straighten up your room!
Harv, let’s take it down a notch.
I’M NOT HARV. I’M YOUR FATHER. AND AROUND HERE I’M STILL THE BOSS! YOU
What’s your problem?
What’s my problem? I’1l tell you what my problem is. You have a job you don’t deserve and you think this is all one big joke.  73.
Wow. And jealousy rears its ugly head.
Jealous? Because you do nothing, make six figures and that nut job Bracken thinks you’re the second coming?
Did you ever think that maybe I’m good at what I’m doing and I’m actually making a difference? Or is it all just a big coincidence that Hibrau is kicking ass?
I’m going to go with coincidence.
This is the guy in the rat suit talking? Real creative stuff, pops.
We're done with this conversation.
Maybe I’m not done.
My house, my rules. You don’t like it? Too bad. Now get that room cleaned before I ground you for a year.
Harvey exits his bedroom dressed for work. He hears a VAC coming from Hutch’s room.
(sotto) Damn right I’m in charge. This is my house. He walks by Hutch’s bedroom and sees a MAID, vigorously cleaning with the vacuum. HE BOILS.
Marilyn and Nicole make breakfast. Harvey rushes in.  74.
Who the hell is that cleaning Hutch’s bedroom?
That’s Ester. Hutch hired her. Harvey drops his head into his hands.
Hutch moved out, Harvey.
What do you mean he moved out?
He said he wanted to try living on his own, by his rules.
Oh he did, did he? That’s what he said?
His exact words were, “Dad is acting like an a-hole. I’m outta here.”
Nicole!
Well, that’s what he said.
Thinks he can one up me, does he?
INT. HUTCH’S DOWNTOWN LOFT - DAY Teddy takes in the spacious, upscale loft.
Unbelievable. This place is sick! Hutch directs a Best Buy delivery guy.  75.
The 65 inch goes in the master and let's hang the 110 inch bad boy over the fire place.
No problem. Another delivery guy enters with a full size SLURPEE MACH
You can hook that sucker up behind the bar.
Done.
Ever have a beer slurpee, Ted-0?
Pure genius. An AIR HORN blasts from the street below.
Our ride is here. Teddy goes to the window, looks out. His eyes light up.

No way. EXT. HUTCH’S LOFT - DAY Hutch greets a teamster driver, CARMINE, as he jumps out the cab of the HIBRAU MOBILE BAR TRUCK. The side of the t been repainted: “Hibrau, The number one choice of real NA fans.”
Hey, Carmine!
Yo boss, we ready to roll?
Ready to go to the races, Ted-0O? Teddy looks at him with disbelief.  76.
If you tell me we’re going to the Milwaukee 500, I’m gonna crap my pants. If you tell me where going to the Milwaukee 500 in that truck, I’m gonna crap your pants.
Then we’ll stop for diapers on the way. Bracken let me pull it from the Milwaukee Fall Festival.
Sick! Teddy looks at Hutch. Hugs him. Hard.
Let’s move her out, Carmine.
You’re the boss, boss.
FIFTY-THOUSAND RABID RACE FANS fill the grandstands aroun the speedway.

Filled with hundreds of RV’s, corporate tents and concessions. The Hibrau truck, which is now converted into a bar, is s up right behind pit row. Best seats in the house. Warburton and Riley help Carmine serve free beer to a SMA CROWD as Hutch and Teddy sit in lounge chairs checking ou the teams prepping for the race.
Dude, if I die right here, today, I’m good with it.
Check it out, there’s Tony Stewart. And over there, Dale Earnhardt Jr. Hutch spots his idol, the squeaky clean NASCAR darling, J GORDON.  77.
Yo, Gordo! Today’s your day! JEFF GORDON looks over to Hutch and gives him the thumbs
Did you see that? Wonder Boy just gave you props.
That’s my main man right there. Hutch calls over to the beer truck.
Riley! How we doin’? Riley is surrounded by HOT CHICKS as he serves them beer.
This doesn’t suck! Warburton tosses out Hibrau t-shirts between pours.
Like, how do I get one of those shirts?
You take the one you have on, off. She does. Then shakes her tits and gives a little giggle. Warburton gives Riley a wink.
Give me some of those shirts! He hands him a stack.
Remember, Hutch said we don’t give these to fat chicks. Got it? Hutch gets up from the lounge chair.
Remember, people! This is all compliments from your friends over at Hibrau! “The number one choice of real NASCAR fans.” Hutch raises his beer cup.  78.
Hibrau rocks! Hibrau rocks! The crowd joins in.

The Hibrau party has swelled to a thousand plus. This is place to be. Hutch and his boys sit on top of the truck w a group of hot girls all sporting Hibrau tank tops. They whoop it up for Jeff Gordon, who’s in the lead, head for the checkered flag.
Bring it, Gordo! Bring it!
He’s got it! Gordon crosses the finish line. Winner.

Okay ladies, shirts up for Mr. Gordon! The girls LIFT THEIR TANK TOPS, saluting Jeff Gordon. EXT. MILWAUKEE MILE SPEEDWAY - WINNER’S CIRCLE Jeff Gordon and his team are up on the podium celebrating their victory. Jeff chugs the ceremonial bottle of milk. REVEAL - Hutch has somehow worked his way into the middle the celebration. He holds up a Hibrau beer can in victory grabs Jeff's arm and raises it.
Jeff Gordon, a true champion! Everyone goes nuts. Jeff goes with it then leans over to Hutch.
I don’t know who you are, kid, but I like your style.  79.
I’m just an impressionable young lad who looks up to you as role model, Mr. Gordon. Hutch grins, presents him with a business card.

Hutch Hutchinson, Vice President, Hibrau Brewing Company. Me and the boys would like to invite you to my little house warming party tonight. It’ll be off the hook. Guaranteed. He hands Jeff the can of Hibrau.
Address is written on the can. Hope you can make it. Hutch fist bumps Jeff and takes off, leaving him dumbfoun Jeff looks at the can.
Hey Jeff, over here! Jeff turns to the Photographer.

Hold up the can! Jeff does so awkwardly. The camera goes SNAP, SNAP. Photographer turns to Hutch who tosses him a Hibrau t-shi EXT. HUTCH’S LOFT - NIGHT The Hibrau truck is parked in front. We FOLLOW the beer t lines that run out of the truck and up the side of the building and into... INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - NIGHT ...the BAR in Hutch’s loft where Carmine mixes Hibrau Slurpees. The party from the raceway is now packed into Hutch’s place. DUDES are partying, GIRLS are going wild and a LIVE BAND rocks the house.  80. In the middle of the make-shift dance floor Hutch grinds out with a HOTTIE. Teddy, Warburton and Riley egg on Hutc into some dirty dancing.
Tear it up, dude! Own that ass! Hutch actually has some moves. He spins, krumps, etc., as onlookers cheer him on. The song ends and the place erupts.
Hutch, you are the king!
His majesty needs a refill on ye ‘ol Hibrau. As they head over to the bar... JEFF GORDON and his PIT CREW enter through the front door
Gordo! Wow! Glad you could make it. Jeff Gordon looks around.
Great set up.
Thanks. This is Teddy, Riley and Warburton.
Frickin’ awesome!
Nice to meet you guys. This is my pit crew. They exchange hellos.
Welcome, guys. Make yourself at home. How ‘bout some cold refreshing Hibrau?
I’m not much of drinker. You have any milk? Hutch leads him to the bar.  81.
C'mon. One beer won't kill ya. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - LATER Hutch is working the party. He passes a group of girls.
Having a good time, ladies? Remember, “Girls who drink Hibrau are prettier than girls who don’t.” They look at him like he makes sense.
Hell yeah! Awesome! He strolls over to the BAR where Jeff Gordon is POUNDING BEERS with his pit crew.
Not much of a drinker, huh, Gordo? Jeff Gordon has transformed from goody, goody Jekyll to p monster Hyde.
Wooo! This party is insane! YEAH!
There ya go. That’s the Hibrau spirit- Jeff Gordon GRABS a bowl of peanuts off the bar, dumps it his mouth like he’s slurping soup.
Looks like someone’s a little hungry.
Hungry like the wolf, bitch! Jeff Gordon leans into Hutch. Whispers...
Let’s get it on. Hutch is a little creeped, not sure what he means.
Chicks, brother. Wonder Boy needs some tail!  82.
Oh. Not a problem. Hutch WHISTLES over to a BLONDE on the couch. Gestures fo her to come over. She does.
Katie, this is Jeff- Jeff Gordon GRABS HER. BLASTS his tongue into her mouth.
Katie SLAPS him.
What the hell, dude? Jeff Gordon grabs his cheek. Stunned.
Wonder Boy likey, a lot. Katie storms off.
Uh, Gordo, you’re like red-lining here. Maybe down shift a gear or two? Jeff Gordon's focus is across the room where Teddy, Riley Warburton play NASCAR ‘09 on the 110 inch plasma.
You race?
Do I race? I’m like unbeatable.
Then maybe you should stop acting like a little pussy and get ready to take an ass beating.
You don’t want to go there, Gordo. Jeff Gordon drains his beer then stares down Hutch.
My picture’s on the God damn game box.  83.

Let’s do this. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - MOMENTS LATER The entire party gathers around Hutch and Jeff Gordon as get ready to duel it out in NASCAR ‘09. Hutch does warm-up taps on his controller. Jeff Gordon ge stretched out by his pit crew. Riley holds up a Hibrau t-shirt as a starting flag.
Racer’s on your mark...Set...Go! Hutch and Jeff Gordon hit their controllers, taking off i their virtual cars to the CHEERS of the crowd. The go neck and neck through the first lap.
Looks like someone's played this before.
I can race this mother in my sleep. As they come around the turn Jeff Gordon pulls into the l
Oh, yeah? Don’t forget who consulted on this thing. Hutch quick taps his controller and tries to go inside. J Gordon blocks him.
Rookie move, bitch. Hutch executes a series of COMPLICATED TAPS and his CAR R to the outside, edging past Jeff Gordon.
What the hell? I’ve never seen that move!
Special unlocking code from Japan. Very hard to obtain. And even harder to execute. Jeff Gordon's CREW CHIEF steps up.  84.

Tires are low, J.G., pull her in! Jeff Gordon's steers the car into the pit. He hands the controller to the Crew Chief. His Pit Crew crowds around the controller, inputting repa Hutch calls out to Warburton...
We've got an eighth of a tank. Hold her for another lap! Jeff Gordon slams down a beer.
(to his crew) LET'S GO! LET’S GO! Teddy watches Gordon’s pit crew. Notices something.
Hey! They’re using illegal cheats to increase horsepower!
No we’re not! Crew Chief PUSHES Teddy. He falls into Warburton.
Warburton PUSHES Crew Chief back, harder. He FALLS into J Gordon who spills his beer all over himself. Hutch stands up, still focused on the racing.
Everybody chill out! Okay? Jeff Gordon is drenched with beer...and really pissed. He winds up and throws a PUNCH at Warburton...but MISSES and CONNECTS with Riley’s face.
FRIGGIN’ NOSE!  85. Hutch drops his controller and TACKLES Jeff Gordon. IT TU INTO AN ALL OUT BRAWL.

It’s the big day for the new ideas. Bracken and Hutch, wi cut above his eye from the Jeff Gordon fight, listen as Pittman and his team, dressed in WEASEL costumes, finish their marketing presentation.
...Weayaya The Weasel will be the new face of Hibrau. He’s fun, mischievous and most importantly, loves Hibrau beer.
Weayaya?
It’s Native American. Sioux. It means, “The Setting Sun.” Everyone is confused.
I actually kind of like it. Has some great subliminal messages.
If you like it, Hutch, I like it. Well done, Pittman. ACROSS THE ROOM Harvey and Phil wait their turn.
Maybe we should have stuck with the Badger thing.
Little S.0.B did that on purpose. (confident) Don’t worry, we’re going to blow everyone out of the water.
Okay, who’s next? Harvey and Phil gather up their stack of presentation boa  86.

Today we’re going to present to you the next generation in Hibrau marketing. Although our budget is limited, Phil and I have been able to secure a sponsorship deal that will put the Hibrau name in front of millions of potential new customers in an arena that up ‘till now has only been accessible to the big boys at Miller and Budweiser. Harvey holds up a poster board showing a pack of NASCAR c racing around track. He gives Hutch an “I gotcha now” smi
These “supercharged billboards” race each week at tracks around the country and are amongst the highest rated events in sports television. Phil hands him another poster board.
Through savvy negotiations, we have secured a deal with NASCAR superstar, Mark Martin! Harvey turns over the poster board that shows the Mark Ma racing car.
Uh, his car has a big tiger on it and says “Frosted Flakes”.
Phil, next board please. Phil displays a board with a close up of the front quarte panel of the Kellogg’s car filled with a bunch of TINY DE including a Hibrau.
(pointing to the picture) See, here we are, to the left of the Beef Jerky sticker, above the Ritz Crackers and between the Winston Lights and Purina Cat Chow. Harvey looks proudly toward Bracken.
This is where we want to be, sir.  87.
Hutch, we discussed this. You still feel strongly about it?
(whispers to Phil) Let’s see the little S.0.B. get out of this one.
I do, sir. 100%.
Good work, gentlemen-

And I don’t want to step on any toes but as coincidence would have it, I had the opportunity to put together a little NASCAR deal as well. Hutch walks over to the door and opens it. In walks a black-eyed JEFF GORDON, DRESSED IN A LEATHER HIBRAU RACING SUIT. He’s accompanied by a bruised up Tedd Riley and Warburton sporting “Hibrau Racing Team" swag.
“Hibrau, the number one choice of real NASCAR fans.” The jaws in the room are all on the floor. Harvey’s nut s is there as well.

Through creative deal making and, more importantly, some kind of freakish brotherly bond born out of barbaric male-bonding, my man Gordo here has agreed to become part of the Hibrau family. Hutch presents a mini scale model of the new HIBRAU RACIN CAR. The room APPLAUDS. Harvey is a mess.
It’s an honor to be part of this exciting opportunity. Racing cars and working with guys like Hutch is what life is all about. Hutch gives him a hug.  88.
Thanks, Gordo. Sorry again about the shiner.
It’s all good, brother.
Bravo! Hutch acknowledges Teddy, Riley and Warburton.
My guys here know the world of NASCAR better than anyone I know. With your approval, Arthur, I’d like them to head up the team.
Brilliant!
And we can incorporate Weayaya The Weasel into the marketing.
I love it! All of it! The room gives a standing ovation as the guys pass out th mini-model Hibrau racing cars. Harvey is melting down.
Harvey has a crazed look in his eye as he stares at the m model Hibrau car on his desk.
(talking to the car) You think you’re so great, don’t you? He gently pushes the car around the desk like a ten year-
All shiny and fast...and full of great ideas...VROOM, VROOM. (being the voice of the car) Look at me, I’m perfect! Harvey moves the car around a paperweight then over a sta of post-it notes.  89.
I can do anything I want. He guides the car toward his stapler.

Oh, look. There’s a giant stapler in the middle of the track...No problem, I'll just go over it....Here I go over the stapler because I’m the greatest... With his other hand he picks up the stapler AND SMASHES T MODEL CAR INTO A 100 PIECES.
There’s a KNOCK AT THE DOOR. Harvey snaps back to reality
Just a sec. He quickly cleans up the destroyed car. Gathers himself.
Okay, come in. The door opens and in marches Sargent Heinrick from secur
Guten tag, Mr. Hutchinson. Heinrick looks down at his note pad.
Hutchinson. You related to Hutch Hutchinson, the genius man-child?
(annoyed) Yes. Kind of busy here.
As you know, we are in the thick of our ongoing investigation to expose this worthless excuse for a human being that exterminated Mr. Bracken’s Bentley.
As I said, I’m busy. What do you want from me?  90. Heinrick scans his notes.
I have an eye witness claiming they saw you exit the building quote, “In a frenzy”, the day of the incident.

I've worked at Hibrau for twenty- five years. Everyday feels like a frenzy. Now, if you’1l excuse me, Sargent, I’ve got work to do. Heinrick gives him a long stare then turns for the door. He sees something on the floor and bends down to grab it. It’s a WHEEL from the Hibrau model car. He turns to Harve
I’ve got my eye on you, Hutchinson. He pockets the wheel and is out the door. Harvey slams hi head down on the desk. FADE TO BLACK.
Winter has come. The snow falls on a huge Christmas tree front of the main building.
Holiday decorations are everywhere. Angela’s at her desk working Hutch’s calls.

Happy holidays, Hutch Hutchinson's office...Please hold...Hutch Hutchinson’s office... INT. HUTCH’S OFFICE - DAY Hutch, stressed out, stands behind his desk juggling call reviewing reports, etc. Teddy and Riley are kicked back on the couch. Warburton i putting golf balls.  gl.
(into phone) That’s not gonna fly. The holidays are around the corner. Get on it! He disconnects then yells out to Angela.
Angela, I need the year-end employee review schedule!
Coming! Hutch rubs his temples.
Dude, you need to chill.

Chill? I need to chill? I don’t have time to chill, or sleep or anything. Holiday sales are flat, this crappy weather has distribution way behind and I've got employee year-end reviews coming out of my ass.
Like I said, you need to chill. Angela comes in with the folder.
Here you go. The guys check out her ass as she leaves.
You guys are pigs.
And?
And are we on track with the NASCAR stuff?
Yup.
Yup? What the hell is yup?  92.
It means yes. Seriously Hutch, you’re going to have a heart attack. He plops on the couch between ‘em.
I know. I’m really stressed. The only thing that used to stress me out was running out of weed. Warburton puts his arm around him. He does. They file
It’s all good, guy. Take a breath.
You guys coming to the company Christmas party next week?
Yup.
Yup.
Yup.
Smart ass punks. Get out of my office. out.
Remember who loves you, Hutch. INT. HIBRAU BREWING CO. - HUTCH’S OFFICE - DAY Hutch is all business as he gives Harvey his year-end rev Harvey looks worn, beaten down, the life sucked out of hi
Not a terribly productive fourth quarter. What’s going on, Harv? Harvey just stares off.  93.
Hello? Anybody home?
Huh? Did you say something?
I’ve put you on the Winter Brew campaign and you've given me very little. Your lack of effort is hurting sales.
(lifeless) I‘1l get on it.
What happened to your enthusiasm? Your love for this company?
Whatever. I’11 work on it.
Harvey, you need to pull it together.
I heard you. Can you please stop harassing me about everything.
Bracken is riding my ass like nobody's business. Now get your act together or there’s going to be consequences.
Consequences?
For starters, I’m holding your year- end bonus until things improve. Harvey stares at Hutch, “Are you joking?”
Now get out there and get to work. There’s still a few hours before the Christmas party. Make the most of them.  94.
The company Christmas party in full swing. Employees eat, drink and be merry. Harvey and Phil stand by the punch bowl that sits at the of a long buffet table. Harvey is fuming.
Can you believe it? My own flesh and blood gives me a bad year-end review!
Well, my review went great. Harvey shoots him a look then chugs his punch.
At least we got a nice bonus.
You got a bonus?
(back peddling) I can’t remember. Harvey chugs another glass of punch. He spots Hutch and T across the room laughing it up with a couple of secretari
That little bastard.
(to a secretary) Ask Teddy here. I’ve always had this freaky business sense.
Dude, the only business sense you had was getting out of the way when you puked all over yourself. Hutch elbows him.
Ow!
He’s just kidding around. Right, Teddy?  95.
No. Hutch SMASHES his heel down on Teddy’s toe.
Yes!
Will you ladies excuse us? Hutch pulls Teddy aside.
What are you doing?
Um, getting wasted at a Christmas party and trying to bag that red headed chick.
You can’t say that kind of stuff around the employees. I need to maintain an authoritative persona.
Did you just say, “authoritative persona”, or was that some other asshole?
I told you, I’m under a lot of pressure. (beat) I’m sorry, okay?
Just lighten up and have fun. Can you still do that?

head_text.subj: AT THE FRONT OF THE ROOM

text: The band stops playing and Bracken takes the mike.
Welcome everybody to the annual Hibrau holiday party! Everyone claps.

Every year we have a talent competition, and this year is no exception. So whoever has on their dancing shoes and wants to win some fantastic prizes, waltz yourself out to the dance floor! Teddy grabs Hutch. Raises his arm.
Hutch is in! The crowd cheers.
What the hell are you doing?
Dude, you said you could still have fun. So here you go.
No, I’m not doing it.
Hutch reluctantly gives in.
Okay, okay. I’m in. HARVEY, who continues to pound the punch, lights up.
Phil, hold my jacket.
What are you doing?

He stole my promotion, took my position at short stop and held my bonus, but he ain’t takin’ this one. Opportunity knocks, Phil. Hutch is finally going down! Harvey chugs the rest of his drink and stumbles to the da floor. He gets right up in Hutch’s face.

head_text.subj: YOU'RE GOING DOWN, MR. I CAN HIT A

text: That was weird. Hutch grabs Harvey. Pulls him in so no one can hear.
Did you hear the man? He said dance contest. You’re going to embarrass yourself. Take a seat-

head_text.subj: OH, LOOK, EVERYONE. MR. BIG TIME

text: VICE PRESIDENT IS SCARED HE’S GOING
Stop it, will you? Harvey clucks around like a chicken. Hutch has had enough

Fine. Let’s do this. The MUSIC starts. They walk in a circle sizing each other Harvey eases in to an 80’s dance grove then transitions i Michael Jackson’s THRILLER. Hutch is completely surprised Harvey's dancing ability.

That’s right. Your old man here has got some moves! Harvey stops on a dime and SPANKS HIS ASS AT HUTCH. The c loves it. Hutch signals the band to up the beat. He moves out to th middle of the floor and busts out a sick B-boy routine. Harvey and Hutch battle back and forth: BREAKIN’, SALSA, RIVER DANCE, MACARENA, HAVA NAGILA. The crowd cheers them Harvey motions for the crowd to back up to give him room. winks over to the band and they start playing, “YOU SHOUL DANCING”, by the Bee Gee's. Harvey pulls off a perfect, move-by-move dance sequence o the famous Travolta solo dance scene from “SATURDAY NIGHT FEVER". It's amazing.
Ladies and Gentleman, we have a winner! The crowd goes nuts. Hutch goes to shake Harvey’s hand.  98.
Good win. Really impressed- Harvey pulls his hand away. Flails around like a mad man. Trash talking.

head_text.subj: I TOOK YOU DOWN, LOSER. I AM THE

text: Easy, Harv.
EASY LIKE SUNDAY MORNING. THAT’S

head_text.subj: HOW I BEAT YOU, MR. VICE PRESIDENT

text: Harvey continues to bounce around and trash talk...

head_text.subj: BUT HE LOSES CONTROL AND BUSTS A MOVE INTO THE BUFFET TAB

text: taking out the table legs. Like a row of dominos, one-by- the trays full of food CRASH to the floor, ending with a smashing punch bowl finale, drenching Harvey. The room is silent. Bracken walks over to Harvey and hand him his prize.

Congratulations on the win. Harvey looks at the prize. It’s a HIBRAU RACING TEAM t-sh A few CLAPS from the crowd then everyone goes back to drinking and mingling. Harvey crawls off through the buffet slop, already forgot
Harvey braces himself from the frigid cold and shuffles toward the snow filled parking lot, a broken man.

It’s early in the morning and Angela is the first one in. makes her way to her desk. She flips the page on her calender to the NEW YEAR then h into Hutch’s office.  99. INT. HUTCH’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Angela enters and flips the lights on. HUTCH IS FACE DOWN THE FLOOR. She rushes over to him.
Hutch! Are you okay? He wakes up.
Huh? Yeah. Hey, Angela. I must have fallen asleep. I haven't been home in two days.
What are you doing here?
Sales were way off over Christmas and Bracken blew his load. I’ve been working all week. How was Chicago?
It was fine. Got to see the family and eat like a pig.
Cool.
How was your Christmas?
I spent it at Taco Bell.
What?
I got in another fight with my dad.
You need to work things out with him, Hutch.
I can’t deal with it right now. I have too much work to do.  100.
Bracken rants around the room like a rabid dog. Hutch key on Harvey who looks like a shell of his former self.

It was our worst holiday season in years. I don’t want to hear excuses! If you’re not performing, you're gone. That goes for all of you! Harvey just stares off into space. Hutch knows it’s only matter of time until Harvey gets the axe.
The meeting has broken up. Harvey passes Hutch as he exit the room.
Hey. But Harvey’s in another world. He walks past without a wo
Good to see you, too.
Hutch inspects the paint job on the new Hibrau racing car with Teddy, Warburton and Riley. He’s really stressed.
The hood logo is not big enough. I told you guys, quarter panel to quarter panel.
It’s just a mock up. We’1ll adjust it.
And the green color is not right. It looks like frickin’ Lucky Charms. What the hell, guys?
We can change it. Season doesn’t start for a few more weeks. We have plenty of time.  101.
That your lame excuse?
Calm down, man.
Don’t “man” me! This is not acceptable! It’s going to be my ass if this isn’t right.
You better remember who you’re talking to, Hutch. We’re not your little patsies at the office.
What you guys are is complete screw ups! I hand you the dream job of a lifetime and you can’t even get the simple stuff straight. He stares at Teddy waiting for a response.
Hutch, go screw yourself, you douche bag. Teddy turns and walks out. Warburton follows.
That’s real mature. He turns to Riley.
Those numb nuts don’t realize what a good thing they have.
Neither do you, Hutch. Riley heads out the door.
Screw you guys! You’re dead weight anyway! Hutch gathers himself. He takes a deep breath trying to c down. He looks over at the car.
It’s the wrong shade of green.  102. He SCREAMS then punches the air. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - NIGHT Hutch is on the couch reviewing sales reports. There’s a KNOCK at the door.
Annoyed, he goes to open the door.
(surprised) Mom? Marilyn balances a stack of Tupperware.
I hope you’re hungry. I brought leftovers.
You didn’t have to do that. She looks around at the fast food wrappers, pizza boxes a empty Red Bull cans scattered around the loft.
Yes, I did. Now invite me in before I drop the Tupperware. Hutch grabs the stack and leads her over to the couch. Sh notices the paperwork.
Looks like they have you working pretty hard.
You wouldn't believe it. (beat) But I got it handled.
You sound like your dad.
Funny one.
I’m not joking, Hutch.  103. Hutch takes a moment. Then...
How’s he doing?
I think he misses you.
Yeah, misses telling me what to do.
He really does, Hutch. And deep down inside, he’s incredibly proud of you.
He’s got a funny way of showing it.
He’s going through a weird time right now. (beat) I’m not telling you what to do, but despite his faults, your dad has always been there for you. Make an effort, okay?
Hutch gathers himself then KNOCKS on Harvey’s office door
He’s not here, Hutch. Hutch turns to see Phil behind him.
Hey, Phil. Is my dad at lunch?
He didn't come in. Took a sick day.
A sick day? I don’t think he’s ever taken a sick day. Is he sick? Phil leans in.
Between you and me, I think he’s just sick of coming in.  104.
Marilyn serves Harvey some lunch.
Okay, Harv. I’ve got to go show a house. You going to be okay?
I’m fine. (beat) Are things going well?
Is what going well?
Your career. Is your career going well? She looks at him curiously.
It’s going great. Thanks for asking.
Where’s the showing?
Over on Maple. Three bedroom craftsman.
Knock ‘em dead.
Thanks, Harvey. She gives him a kiss and heads out.
Harvey enters the living room where Nicole is working on video project.
Hey dad, how come there’s hardly any video from the last few years? (MORE )

There’s tons of footage from when you and Mom first got married and when we were little kids, but it’s pretty thin after that. Why did you stop filming stuff? This hits Harvey hard. He doesn’t know what to say.
It’s cool, Dad. I’11 make it work.

Harvey comes upstairs to call it a night. He stops in fro of Hutch’s old bedroom, then goes in. INT. HUTCH’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Rachael Ray lays on the bed, totally depressed. Harvey looks around the sterilized room. The energy of Hu has been cleaned away. Harvey has a moment. Then... Begins MESSING UP THE room. Unmaking the bed, tossing PlayStation games and magazines. He opens the drawers and unloads socks and underwear onto the floor. He looks around, grins.
That’s better. Rachael Ray BARKS in agreement. Harvey turns to walk out. Marilyn stands in the doorway.
Quit being a stubborn ass and go talk to him. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - NIGHT A KNOCK on the door. Hutch opens it, revealing Harvey.
(uncomfortable) Hey, Hutch.  106.
(more uncomfortable) I thought you were the pizza guy. Come on in. Harvey enters the loft.
Wow. Nice place.
It’s fine. I’m not really here that much.
Long hours at work, huh?
Like 24-7. They head over to the couch. Harvey notices a pile of crumpled up paper on the coffee table.
What are you working on?
Bracken’s riding my ass for new product ideas. He doesn’t let up.
Got anything?
Not yet. Unless neon colored beer sounds like a good idea?
I’ve heard better. (beat) Do you have a minute to talk?
Sure. They sit. Hutch tears a Red Bull out of a case on the flo
Drink? Harvey waves it off. Hutch opens one for himself.  107.
You sure? Drink this stuff and you can stay up for a week.
You have any beer?
(sarcastic) Do I have any beer? Hutch goes to the fridge and grabs a six pack of Hibrau. heads back to the couch and hands a beer to Harvey.
Join me? Hutch is suspicious.
This feels like some kind of set- up. Thought I couldn't drink in front of you?
That’s when you were just a dumb ass kid. Open one for yourself, will ya? Hutch opens one. Harvey holds up his can.

A toast. To my son...and boss, Hutch Hutchinson, who’s not only smart and a hard worker, but has proven that there’s not just one path to success. I’m really proud of you and I’m sorry it’s taken me so long to tell you. (beat) More importantly, I want you to know that having you in my life and spending time with the family is more important than any promotion. Hutch is touched. Holds up his can.
I’1l drink to that. (beat) And to Harvey Hutchinson. One hell of an S.O.B. who taught me everything I know. (MORE )
And even though he’s made my life hell for the past twenty years, I wouldn't trade him for a million stock options. (beat) And I’m sorry if I give you too much of your own medicine.

Fair enough. I’11 drink to that. They clink cans. Hutch chugs his beer then crushes the ca against his head. Harvey looks at Hutch like he’s nuts. Then Harvey chugs h beer and crushes the can like Hutch. They both crack up. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - LATER Empty beer cans litter the coffee table. Hutch and Harvey pretty buzzed. They laugh it up and tell stories, bonding
Yeah. Well when I was a senior in High School I got caught with a girl in the locker room.
Big deal.
She was my Spanish teacher.
Nice!
Don’t tell your mother.
Well, once Teddy and I broke into a house and stole their new Sony plasma. We pawned it to get tickets for a Bucks game.
What? You said I could tell you anything.  109.

head_text.subj: THAT TV WAS FROM OUR LIVING ROOM

text: Oops. We were pretty messed up that night. Sorry. Harvey lets it go. They share a laugh.
Okay. If I tell you this next thing you have to swear you will never tell anybody.
(crosses himself) On the hot Asian weather chick from CNN.
I was the one who busted up Bracken’s Bentley.
Oh yes, I did. The day you got the promotion. It was sort of an accident. Hutch toasts him.
You, my pops, are the king of kings! Harvey grabs for his beer but MISTAKENLY PICKS UP A RED B AND TAKES A BIG SWIG. He perks up.
Whoa! What’s in this stuff?
I don’t know. All sorts of crap. (reading the can) “Red Bull vitalizes the body and mind." Harvey chugs some more as a light bulb flickers in his he
You know what would be an interesting idea?  110.
Taking this father son bonding thing to the next level and calling over some hookers?
No. Check this out. Harvey holds up a can of Hibrau and a can of Red Bull
(with a grin) Hibrau energy beer.
Genius!
Bet that stuff would sell, huh?
Like naked pictures of Vanessa Hudgens. Hutch grabs a note pad off the coffee table. They start t riff on the idea.

head_text.subj: HARVEY AND HUTCH WORK ON THE ENERGY BEER IDEA

text: -- Late night in Harvey's office, they work on the concep Harvey's got his motivation back. -- Harvey and Hutch taste energy beer samples with the Br Master. -- Harvey shows Hutch a mock up of the energy beer can. H loves it. -- Hutch has reconciled with his boys. Consults with them the energy beer concept. -- Hutch and Harvey play PlayStation in Hutch’s loft, finalizing ideas and laughing it up. Father and son are a peace.
Harvey and Hutch practice the energy beer presentation to Marilyn and Nicole.  111.
And that, ladies and gentleman, is the all new Hibrau Energy Beer. Hutch holds up the mock up can.
“Hibrau Energy Beer -- Have a blast!". Marilyn and Nicole love it. They APPLAUD.
Thank you, thank you! Harvey grabs something from under the table. It’s a BRAND VIDEO CAMERA. He hands it to Nicole.
How about we go through it again and you can film it. Maybe use the footage for your project.
Awesome. Thanks, Dad. She fires up the camera and they go again.
Harvey and Hutch stand outside the conference room.
You ready to do this?
It’s on.
Like Donkey Kong.
What?
Just go with it. They bump fists.  112.
Hutch and Harvey give their presentation to Bracken and t Execs.
It’s a revolutionary new product that could double Hibrau’s market share within six months. This man next to me, Harvey Hutchinson, is the brain child behind this incredible idea. Harvey.
Thank you, Hutch. What I’m about to present here combines- THE DOOR OPENS and IN WALKS SARGENT HEINRICK. He carries file folder.
Sargent Heinrick, we’re in the middle of a meeting.
I’ve solved it, sir. We found the scum that exterminated your Bentley, sir. He opens the file folder and tosses out GRAINY PHOTOS OF HARVEY AT THE SCENE OF THE CRIME.
(sotto) Crap. Bracken looks at the photos then to Harvey.
An inside job. I’m disappointed in you, Hutchinson.
Mr. Bracken, it was an accident.
Sargent Heinrick, arrest this man!
But- Sargent Heinrick pulls out the cuffs.  113.
Sir, please let me explain?
Make it quick.

I've worked at Hibrau for twenty- five years and I've put my heart and soul into this place. Sometimes at the cost of my own family. The day I accidently wrecked your car was a very emotional time for me. I know I should have come forward earlier, but I didn't, and that was a mistake. I truly apologize, sir. Bracken contemplates...
Arrest him, Sargent Heinrick, and he’s fired. Get this man out of my face. Heinrick approaches Harvey.
I’1l1 leave on my own, thank you. (to Bracken) And for the record, I quit! Harvey walks to the door with his head held high.
Hutch, can we get on with it? What’s this great idea? Hutch looks over to Harvey, then back to Bracken.
Well Mr. Bracken, the great idea is that...you can go fuck yourself. Harvey can’t believe what Hutch just did. But he loves it
How dare you! You’1ll never work in this business as long as I live!
Let’s hope that won’t be too long. Hutch walks over to Harvey who stands at the door.  114.
How ‘bout we get the hell out of this dump, “Dad”?
That sounds like a great idea, “Son”. As they head out the door they both turn around and FLIP BRACKEN. FADE OUT.
The whole family is gathered around the television, eatin pizza and watching Nicole’s completed video project.
We see Hutch and Harvey practicing the presentation the d Harvey gave Nicole the camera.
...then my dad and my brother come up with this amazing idea for the company they work at.

Hutch and Harvey are in the DRIVEWAY the day of the Hibra presentation. Marilyn wishes them good luck. Harvey's about to get into the passenger seat of Hutch’s Benz. Hutch whistles to him, then tosses Harvey the keys.
Hutch and Harvey arrive home after getting fired.
How'd it go?
Not quite as planned. We got fired.
What? Oh, no-  115.
It was awesome! And we took the bus home. Harvey grabs Marilyn. Plants her with a passionate kiss.
Let’s celebrate. Dinner wherever you guys want! Marilyn looks over at Nicole who’s filming and shrugs.
I think they’ve gone insane.
I kind of like it. She grabs Harvey and kisses him back.
Hutch and Harvey are working intently.
Both Dad and Hutch are out of work but they’re like really stoked and acting weird, working on some secret project.
Harvey and Hutch take a break from working and play hocke with golf clubs. Harvey scores a goal on Hutch and lifts club in the air.
But they were having fun and acting like idiots as well.
The garage has been transformed into a real work space. H and Harvey address their STAFF which includes Teddy, Warburton, Riley, Angela and Phil.
Thanks to all of your hard work, Hutch and I are proud to present... Hutch reaches into a box and pulls out a can of...  116.

Hutchinson Energy Beer! Everyone applauds. Hutch breaks open the box and passes o the cans. He hands one to Harvey. Nicole ZOOMS IN ON THE CANS as Hutch and Harvey toast. She ZOOMS OUT to revel that we are now in...
Hutch and Harvey stand together in the small brewery.
Cheers! The staff has gotten larger. They all raise their cans.
Cheers!
It was pretty amazing what they pulled off. Hutch turns to Harvey.
Okay, so you sure you can handle this on your own?
Very funny. Hutch scoops up his book bag.
I‘’1l be back after my marketing exam.
Pass it or you’re fired.
That’s the old Harv I love. Hutch and Teddy take off as Harvey celebrates with the st
Harvey, Marilyn, Hutch and Rachael Ray hang out.  117.

Things were going great for the Hutchinsons. In addition to the brewery, Dad was at peace, Hutch was in school, Mom had her family back and I finally finished this project. Nicole joins the family in front of the camera. Wrangles to pose for a final shot.
And that is the story of the Hutchinsons. It’s not all pretty, but it’s all true.
The family applauds. Rachael Ray BARKS her support...Then SNATCHES the pizza box and dashes toward the stairs. The Hutchinson’s laugh it up as they scramble after her. FADE OUT.
